data.title: Cool concept
data.text: Nice movie theater with great food! You can order from your seat by pressing a button and a waiter comes to get your order. They deliver it to your seat within minutes. The seats have a small table and another button you can use to turn on a light. The only con is that the drinks are very expensive (a soda is $4.50). The food, however, is not unreasonably priced, and they serve for the late showings as well. Overall, great experience!

data.title: To Joey, With Love
data.text: My first time there and I enjoyed the movie,  we also ate there. The food was ok but next time we will eat before we go, too expensive and not worth the price.  I liked the theater. It was clean and the service was good with a friendly staff. Next time I'll try dessert 😊

data.title: The food is pretty good
data.text: Very good food for a theater. Prices are decent and a good selection of draft beer. You can eat near the bar or be served while watching the movie.

data.title: Excellent night out
data.text:
This was the first time for us to visit and we were impressed today the least.  Instead of driving to eat then movie, jaunt do it all at one time. Ticket prices were inline with other theaters, food was very good, but was a little pricey if ya have a larger family. 
Al in all, I give it a 2 thumbs up👍👍.

data.title: As a movie theater is good! As a food service... NOT!
data.text: The movie theater has the latest technology so it is a good place to watch movies. But saying as a food service... they serve better food at McDonalds or Burger King! Don't waste your money buying their food..

data.title: Our go to
data.text: This is usually our go to movie date place.  The food is pretty good.  I always get the pulled pork sandwich and it's excellent.  The full bar is great.  The seats are way bigger than the regular theater, so even if you're not going to eat, it's a more comfortable way to watch a movie.  The tickets are no more expensive either.

data.title: Movie
data.text: Nice dinner and movie. Full serve restaurant. I had the Kevin Bacon Burger. Burger was good but the steak fries were a little cold and soft.

data.title: Better than I expected.
data.text:
Honestly, I didn't have very high expectations of the food at a movie theater. I was pleasantly surprised. I have been here on several occasions and have eaten in the bar area as well as in the theater. The food was good.  Think along the lines of an Applebee's or Chilis. It was not overpriced like I expected. The service is slow no matter where you choose to eat but it was a small inconvenience. I wouldn't recommend eating in the theater. It was difficult to see the plate and although the seat has a light, I didn't want to turn it on lest I bother other patrons. 

This is my favorite theater in Athens. It's definitely worth a visit.

data.title: Dinner and a movie done well.
data.text: Good selection of beers and full bar.  The food is much better than past experiences at other movie theaters with full food/drink service.  The food actually tastes like it was prepared on site and not just microwaved.  Actually, it's pretty tasty on the scale of high-end bar food, which is not a knock against.  The service is also good.

data.title: Best type of bar/restaurant/in theater experience in Athens
data.text: Been to Ovations 12 twice now. Wide selection in the menu and drinks. Pleased with the service. Expect it to get better as they mature. Still best choice in Athens if you wish to eat and drink during a movie in comfortable seats. Their only competition in Athens is University 16 but they only have one theater configured for food/drinks. And then you are stuck with what is playing in that particular theater. Movie Tavern inSuwanee is the best setup but it is a 45 minute plus drive for us.

data.title: Updated Well. Food Service Still Needs Work.
data.text:
My husband and I took in the new Mission Impossible here and, as longtime residents of Athens (long enough to remember what the theatre looked like before the reno), we were both impressed with how much cleaner and nicer everything is now. 

The ticketing process was super quick, with plenty of terminals for this who purchased online, the bar served up some decent fare, and while the margarita I had could've been tastier, I enjoyed it.

Inside the theater, there was plenty of leg room and the seats were comfy. The food was so-so, but my husband wasn't impressed, so we'll likely stick to popcorn only next time. 

As far as the quickness of the service, this will need more fine-tuning. We were lucky to get our order in early, so we were done by the time the movie kicked off, but others waited 15-30 minutes for their food.

In all, Ovation offers a better than average experience for those living on the east side.

data.title: Wonderful updated dinner theater
data.text: This is my first visit to this theater in over 5 years and I'm very impressed with the updates. The manager greets you at the door and the atmosphere is like a very nice cocktail bar. There's a full size bar, TVs, and plenty of tables and chairs in the lobby. You have to show proof of age and get a wrist band in the lobby before ordering drinks in the theater. The theater is set up with large chairs with pull-out trays. They had menus at each seat and you can call for the server whenever you want to order. Our server was Devon and she was very friendly and prompt. The food went beyond my expectations for theater food. I got the Blues Brothers burger and my husband got the Three Amigos burger. Both had amazing flavor and the portions were generous. The French fries were especially good. The prices were a little pricey ($12 for burgers and $9 for drinks) but the quality and presentation of food was worth it. Soft drinks were also free refills ($4.50). The only complaint I have was the lighting was poor. I could barely read the menu and had to use my phone to assist. It was also a little disconcerting to be eating food you can barely see. The waitresses/ waiters were a little distracting serving people and handing out checks during the movie but they did a good job of being as discreet as they could. I think anybody who comes to a theater like this has to expect a few disruptions. Overall a wonderful experience and we will return.

data.title: Great Renovation, Still Working Out Lots of Kinks.
data.text: This is a new Dinner/Drinks/Movie venue with a full bar and when they figure out how to make it work it could be a really great place to go. Wide row spacing is great for kids who have a hard time staying in a seat and that alone will bring us back. Our first visit was very frustrating. It's one of those places where you have no idea what's going on unless you have been before. Standing in line with three kids I had to buy tickets and choose which seats we would have even though I'd never been in the theater and had no idea what the seats were like. Three clerks had three different opinions and it turned out not to matter anyway because the theater was mostly empty. You have to get there early if you want popcorn or food because you don't order in the lobby (they should change this). We got there 10 minutes early and the theater was dark. There is a light behind your shoulder, but it emits a 6" circle of dim light making it awkward to see the full sized menu, having to turn 90 degrees to look at it and bumping the person next to you with the menu. The server comes rushing in for your order because the movie is about to begin and you still have no idea what you want. We got popcorn because we couldn't see the menu. I didn't realize the servers would take orders throughout the film, so there was no rush. The server dropped off my check at the climax of the movie and I couldn't read it because of the aforementioned lack of light. When I finally did look he had over charged us $5 and I had to track him down in the hall and wait for a manager to help while my active kiddo ran up and down the hall and sullen tweens glared menacingly. Luckily no other patrons were harmed during this time. Then I had to leave a tip even though the service was weird and imperfect - by design, not the server's fault. So, go early and bring a flashlight. And lots of money.
